title: Clustering by fast search and find of density peaks
subtitle: Reproduction of Rodriguez & Laio (Science, 2014) experiments

title: Motivation & idea
bullets: Cluster centers have high local density
Centers are at relatively large distance from points with higher density
Decision graph (density vs delta) helps select centers
notes: Algorithm identifies cluster centers via high density and large separation.

title: Algorithm (short)
bullets: Compute local density ρ_i (cut-off or kernel)
Compute δ_i = distance to nearest point with higher ρ
Plot decision graph (ρ vs δ) and select centers
Assign each point to same cluster as nearest higher-density neighbor

title: R15 - clusters
notes: Left: cluster result, Right: decision graph slide follows

title: R15 - decision graph
notes: Decision graph: centers marked with X

title: Results summary
bullets: Metrics: ARI, NMI (when true labels known)
Outliers are often isolated points with low ρ and high δ

title: Notes & limitations
bullets: Human selection of centers from decision graph in original paper
High-dimensional datasets require kernel density or PCA preprocessing

title: How to reproduce
bullets: Run run_dpc_experiments.py to create plots and results
Run create_pptx.py to assemble slides automatically
